result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments, DNA surcharge and surcharges.  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance as a condition of Extended Supervision,  by the end of the sentence or civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
*3/24/2016  Honorable Daniel L. Konkol.-credit of 104 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.
AODA, programs or treatment as recommended.  Random screening.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to provide a biological speciment for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge  on each count.
Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge; and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
If defendant possesses a firearm within five (5) years of completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a three (3) year mandatory Initial Confinement.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.  **3/24/2016  Credit for 104 days.
*Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program after serving three (3) years.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. King

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael A. King not in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from Department of Corrections on this date and forwarded to Court for review.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Granting Request for Sentence Credit received and filed.  Court orders credit of 104 day.  Copies mailed to defendant and the State./ds
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit.
Second Amended Information received and filed./ds

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, programs or treatment as recommended; 4) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening. 

COURT ORDERS:
- DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds;
- defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge on each count.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 8 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 5 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 3 years; pay mandatory costs, assessments, DNA surcharge and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 4:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 2 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 1 year; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 1 year - concurrent with Count 1; pay mandatory costs, assessments, DNA surcharge and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years.

Defendant Michael A. King in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Michael A. King in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State files a Second Amended Information to correct scribner's erros.  Charges remain the same.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Second Amended Information and waives reading.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Counts 1 & 4 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 4 as charged in the Second Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On moiton of the State, Court orders Counts 3 & 5 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Count 1:  Manufacture/ Delivery of controlled substance (cocaine)- PTAC, as a party to a crime, second and subsequent offense, contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(1)(cm)2, 939.50(3)(e), 939.05, 961.48(1)(b).  A class E felony.

Count 3:  Bail Jumping (Misdemeanor), contrary to WI Stats sec. 946.49(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a).  A class A midemeanor.

Count 4:  Keeper of a drug house- PTAC, as a party to a crime, contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(1)(cm)2, 939.50(3)(e), 939.05.  A class E felony.

Count 5:  Possession of a controlled substance- Hydrocodone- PTAC, as a party to a crime, contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.18(5)(f), 961.41(3)(g), 939.61, and 939.05.  A class A misdemeanor.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers, SCRAM, if appropriate with program. Defendant Michael A. King in court with attorney Isaak Daniel.  Defendant Michael A. King in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  After discussion with the Commissioner, Defendant and the Defense Attorney,  Court informs the parties that the Court will proceed with a Preliminary Hearing.  The case is temporarily passed. 

Case is recalled on the record. 
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver is withdrawn.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Glen Haase-Cudahy Police Department Sargeant.  After some brief testimony, the case is temporarily passed. 
Case is recalled.  Sworn testimony of Glen Haase continues.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael A. King in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Michael A. King in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a NOT GUILTY plea as to Count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
